summary: This bill, the "Taking Account of Institutions with Low Operation Risk Act of 2025" (TAILOR Act of 2025), aims to tailor financial regulations to the risk profiles and business models of financial institutions. It mandates federal financial regulatory agencies to consider and adjust regulations proportionally, reducing burdens. The bill also requires short-form call reports for eligible community banks, a report on modernizing bank supervision, and a review of existing regulations. The agencies must also report their tailoring efforts to Congress.
